Package cetus.hir

Class BinaryExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Expression
      • cetus.hir.BinaryExpression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable, Traversable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Expression>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessExpression, AssignmentExpression
    public class BinaryExpression
extends Expression
    BinaryExpression represents an expression having a LHS operand, an operator, and a RHS operand.

                        BinaryOperator op,
                        Expression rhs)
        Creates a binary expression.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The lefthand expression.
        op - A binary operator.
        rhs - The righthand expression.
        Throws:
        NotAnOrphanException - if lhs or rhs has a parent object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the binary expression. The returned string is equivalent to the printed stream through defaultPrint(cetus.hir.BinaryExpression, java.io.PrintWriter).
        Overrides:
        toString in class Expression
        Returns:
        the string representation.

      • hashCode

        protected int hashCode​(int h)
        Description copied from class: Expression
        Returns cumulative hash code with the given initial value, h. This is intended for optimizing memory usage when computing hash code of an expression object. Previous approach constructs a string representation of the expression to get the hash code while this approach uses the same algorithm as String.hashCode() without creating a string. All sub classes of Expression have there specific implementations of this method and Expression.hashCode() simply returns hashCode(0).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Expression

      • setLHS

        public void setLHS​(Expression expr)
        Sets the lefthand expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The new lefthand expression. It must not be the child of another expression or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if expr is null.
        NotAnOrphanException - if expr has a parent object.

      • setRHS

        public void setRHS​(Expression expr)
        Sets the righthand expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The new righthand expression. It must not be the child of another expression.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if expr is null.
        NotAnOrphanException - if expr has a parent object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the binary expression with the specified object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Expression
        Parameters:
        o - the object to be compared with.
        Returns:
